docs.snippet: European teams say they are more prepared than ever for a hot and humid World Cup, training in saunas, planning to soak their jerseys in cold water before games and working with doctors to design the perfect hydration formula for each player.
docs.lead_paragraph: European teams say they are more prepared than ever for a hot and humid World Cup, training in saunas, planning to soak their jerseys in cold water before games and working with doctors to design the perfect hydration formula for each player.

docs.snippet: Because Ghana eliminated the Americans from the past two World Cups, its fans expect it to win again in their Cup opener, but Coach Kwesi Appiah is after much more.
docs.lead_paragraph: Because Ghana eliminated the Americans from the past two World Cups, its fans expect it to win again in their Cup opener, but Coach Kwesi Appiah is after much more.
docs.abstract: Ghana's national soccer team is preparing for their World Cup opener against the United States, team they have beat in 2006 and in 2010.

headline.main: Ghana Seeks More Than Just Another Cup Win Over U.S.
headline.print_headline: Ghana Seeks More Than Just Another Cup Win Over U.S.

docs.snippet: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel has told reporters that he would decide soon whether to accept a months-old offer to resettle six prisoners in Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel has told reporters that he would decide soon whether to accept a months-old offer to resettle six prisoners in Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel, who is under pressure from Obama administration to step up pace in approving transfer of low-level Guantanamo Bay detainees, tells reporters he will decide soon whether to accept a months-old offer to resettle six prisoners in Uruguay.

headline.main: Under Pressure, Hagel Promises to Act on Guantánamo Transfers

docs.snippet: Group C has a favorite, Colombia, though uncertainty still hangs over its star player. And if all goes well for the South Americans, that leaves Greece, Japan, and Didier Drogba's Ivory Coast to fight for the group's other spot in the round of 16 at...
docs.lead_paragraph: Group C has a favorite, Colombia, though uncertainty still hangs over its star player. And if all goes well for the South Americans, that leaves Greece, Japan, and Didier Drogba's Ivory Coast to fight for the group's other spot in the round of 16 at this year's World Cup in Brazil.

headline.main: Colombia Favored in Group C of World Cup
headline.print_headline: Colombia Favored in Group C of World Cup
